title: Update interactive website
description:
GluCare was born out of the idea that a combination of a human-centric patient approach and a technology working together will lead to a better and more efficient management of diabetes and metabolic syndrome. 

The GluCare team is looking to expand their successful business model from physical interaction to service in the cloud. This new offering will be called Zone.Health. The ask is to build a website that acts as the hub of information in order to get patients to join their program. The various sections of the site will consist of: 

â€¢	â—  What is Zone.health? 
â€¢	â—  The program 
â€¢	â—  Why it works? 
â€¢	â—  Join now 
â€¢	â—  Pricing 
â€¢	â—  FAQs 

We envisage the website to have an onboarding portal which will consist of three parts, an API, a CMS and a Frontend system.

1.	This will allow for future integration into other customer touch points should the need arise. The onboarding journey will consist of: 

1) BMI calculator

If less 27, show a message to say that they donâ€™t qualify. If greater 27, take the user through the registration flow. 

2) Registration (numerous inputs)

Once the patient has provided the above, they will be visible within the custom built CMS. The practitioner will have a login to the CMS whereby they will be able to view the information captured by the patient. They would be able to add specific notes after the consultation and select the medication and the required gear (glucose monitor, wearable and scale) to send to the patient. The idea is that the cost of these items will be built into the system, so that the practitioner can simply select the products, which then creates the payment link. This will be centrally managed in its totality in the CMS. 
Once the payment has been made, the kit will be delivered to the patient and the engagement with Zone.Health will be through the app. However, each month, the practitioner will log into the CMS and create a payment link based on the progress the patient is making. 

All invoices and orders will be available to the patient when logging into the site. It is important to note that the onboarding portal and the mobile app (this has been developed separately and not in the scope of this project) should use the same authentication system in order to prevent the patient having to create two seperate accounts. 
Details will be provided once engagement starts, but we expect the website to consist of:

o	â—  Project set up 
o	â—  Information website build 
o	â—  BMI 
o	â—  Registration 
o	â—  Further screening questions 
o	â—  Laboratory Test Uploads

title: Expert PHP developer who has proven codesignal test
description:
I have an interactive website that needs to be updated. The purpose of the site is to collect comments from users who are directed to the site. I would like a freelancer to propose a price for this work.  

At the site users log in with a username and password that I provide. The project to which they are assigned opens and user then adds one or more comments. There are multiple projects and multiple users so that login credentials ensures that the user accesses the correct project. I have admin rights on the site to set up projects, set up users, assign users to projects and download data collected. I need to make clear that I am not a website administrator, nor do I have deep skills in the technology. While I am tech savvy in a number of areas, and I have managed many tech development projects through Upwork and the predecessor companies. The freelancer will need to communicate with me at my level of understanding. 

The site has not been used much recently and the code is now out of date. Most parts of the site seem to work ok except when a user logs in, their project does not open. I need a freelancer to review the code and update the site (patches, fixes, etc.). I do not need a redesign or new functionality; I only need the code updated. I do have more detailed documentation that I can share with freelancers that are shortlisted. The freelancer who created the site did great work but they are not available at this time so I need a new freelancer who can do this work. 

I have accounts on Heroku and Vercel to support this site and the below is a brief summary of the documentation from the freelancer that created the project.
LIBRARIES & FRAMEWORKS ON THE FRONT END
React JS - React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.
Next JS â€“ Was used to build server-side rendering and static web applications using React.
Styled-Components â€“ This utilizes tagged template literals to style the components.
Material-UI - React components for faster and easier web development.
Js-Cookie â€“ Is a simple, lightweight JavaScript API for handling browser cookies, this was used to read the cookie token stored in the browser and was used for authenticating users as soon as they are signed in using the form on the application.
Isormorphic-Fetch - Isomorphic-fetch is implementation of fetch for both Node.js and browser, this was used to communicate with the backend (server) and used to fetch data stored on the server database and pulled to the frontend.
The rest of the libraries/frameworks can be found in the package.json file on the root directory of the project. Any developer that will be doing further work on the project can find the documentation on the README.MD file on the GitHub page useful and straightforward.

LIBRARIES & FRAMEWORKS ON THE BACK END
Node JS â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code server-side.
Express JS â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code server-side.
Mongoose â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code 
Json2cvs â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code server-side.

I would like someone to pull all the publicly available Uber data of the city of Miami from https://movement.uber.com/explore/miami/travel-times

With the data provided, is it possible (with this data) to figure out how many rides come from each zone/neighborhood of Miami? I think we need to extrapolate that based on the number of rows but I'm not sure, so I need your help to figure this out. I was having trouble because the dataset is too large to open it all at once in Excel.

Once you know the number rides coming *out* of each zone/neighborhood:

1. Break the data down and put it into excel based on all the categories that they have already tagged the data with but do it by zone/neighborhood: 

Rides by Hour of Day (All Days)	
Rides  by Hour of Day (Weekdays Only)	
Rides  by Hour of Day (Weekends Only)	
Rides  by Day of Week	
Rides  by Month (All Days)	
Rides  by Month (Weekdays Only)	
Rides  by Month (Weekends Only)	
Rides  By Date By Hour Buckets (All Days)

2. Create visuals for each each zone in a manner that you feel is the ideal way to present it. Open to suggestions here.

Thank you.

title: Need my Wordpress site Private and only accessible by users that a Super User adds
description:
GluCare was born out of the idea that a combination of a human-centric patient approach and a technology working together will lead to a better and more efficient management of diabetes and metabolic syndrome. 

The GluCare team is looking to expand their successful business model from physical interaction to service in the cloud. This new offering will be called Zone.Health. The ask is to build a website that acts as the hub of information in order to get patients to join their program. The various sections of the site will consist of: 

â€¢	â—  What is Zone.health? 
â€¢	â—  The program 
â€¢	â—  Why it works? 
â€¢	â—  Join now 
â€¢	â—  Pricing 
â€¢	â—  FAQs 

We envisage the website to have an onboarding portal which will consist of three parts, an API, a CMS and a Frontend system.

1.	This will allow for future integration into other customer touch points should the need arise. The onboarding journey will consist of: 

1) BMI calculator

If less 27, show a message to say that they donâ€™t qualify. If greater 27, take the user through the registration flow. 

2) Registration (numerous inputs)

Once the patient has provided the above, they will be visible within the custom built CMS. The practitioner will have a login to the CMS whereby they will be able to view the information captured by the patient. They would be able to add specific notes after the consultation and select the medication and the required gear (glucose monitor, wearable and scale) to send to the patient. The idea is that the cost of these items will be built into the system, so that the practitioner can simply select the products, which then creates the payment link. This will be centrally managed in its totality in the CMS. 
Once the payment has been made, the kit will be delivered to the patient and the engagement with Zone.Health will be through the app. However, each month, the practitioner will log into the CMS and create a payment link based on the progress the patient is making. 

All invoices and orders will be available to the patient when logging into the site. It is important to note that the onboarding portal and the mobile app (this has been developed separately and not in the scope of this project) should use the same authentication system in order to prevent the patient having to create two seperate accounts. 
Details will be provided once engagement starts, but we expect the website to consist of:

o	â—  Project set up 
o	â—  Information website build 
o	â—  BMI 
o	â—  Registration 
o	â—  Further screening questions 
o	â—  Laboratory Test Uploads 
o	â—  Schedule a visit 
o	â—  Confirmation 
o	â—  Payment Process 
o	â—  Account Settings 
o	â—  CMS - View users 
o	â—  CMS - Create payments 
o	â—  CMS - Shipment of your ZoneHealth kit notification 
o	â—  Email Templates Creation 
o	â—  Email Provider Integration 
o	â—  CRM Integration 
o	â—  Scheduling System Integration 
o	â—  Payment Provider Integration 
Video Conferencing Integration 

There are similar businesses in the US and we like this the most: https://joinfound.com

title: Wordpress Site Variation Loading Issues
description:
I have a 3D modding application for Final Fantasy VII, and itâ€™s missing critical animation tools. The main things I think it's missing are a Gizmo to move and rotate joints in 3D space, animation splines to make adjustments to direction and speed, and a real animation bar at the bottom displaying your key frames and etc. It's also lacking automatic interpolation between the keys so you can play test the animation without manually adding additional frames, this makes it much harder if you need an animation
to stay within a certain number of frames. The app has an animation retargeting feature, but it could probably be rounded out a bit more to work more like Maya or Unreal. If possible, it would be helpful to make the app platform agnostic so it can work on both Windows and Mac. If thatâ€™s too much reworking, then maybe just a Mac version as well. This isnâ€™t an absolute necessity, I currently use the app with Wine, but an app that can work natively would be much better. 

I didnâ€™t set a budget because Iâ€™m not sure what something like this would cost, and I didnâ€™t want to discourage anyone from applying. If youâ€™re interested let me know what you think, and how much you think you could complete this for. 

The source code and application is here:

They would be able to add specific notes after the consultation and select the medication and the required gear (glucose monitor, wearable and scale) to send to the patient. The idea is that the cost of these items will be built into the system, so that the practitioner can simply select the products, which then creates the payment link. This will be centrally managed in its totality in the CMS. 
Once the payment has been made, the kit will be delivered to the patient and the engagement with Zone.Health will be through the app. However, each month, the practitioner will log into the CMS and create a payment link based on the progress the patient is making. 

All invoices and orders will be available to the patient when logging into the site. It is important to note that the onboarding portal and the mobile app (this has been developed separately and not in the scope of this project) should use the same authentication system in order to prevent the patient having to create two seperate accounts. 
Details will be provided once engagement starts, but we expect the website to consist of:

title: Power BI Dimensions and Metrics Documentation
description:
I have an interactive website that needs to be updated. The purpose of the site is to collect comments from users who are directed to the site. I would like a freelancer to propose a price for this work.  

At the site users log in with a username and password that I provide. The project to which they are assigned opens and user then adds one or more comments. There are multiple projects and multiple users so that login credentials ensures that the user accesses the correct project. I have admin rights on the site to set up projects, set up users, assign users to projects and download data collected. I need to make clear that I am not a website administrator, nor do I have deep skills in the technology. While I am tech savvy in a number of areas, and I have managed many tech development projects through Upwork and the predecessor companies. The freelancer will need to communicate with me at my level of understanding. 

The site has not been used much recently and the code is now out of date. Most parts of the site seem to work ok except when a user logs in, their project does not open. I need a freelancer to review the code and update the site (patches, fixes, etc.). I do not need a redesign or new functionality; I only need the code updated. I do have more detailed documentation that I can share with freelancers that are shortlisted. The freelancer who created the site did great work but they are not available at this time so I need a new freelancer who can do this work. 

I have accounts on Heroku and Vercel to support this site and the below is a brief summary of the documentation from the freelancer that created the project.
LIBRARIES & FRAMEWORKS ON THE FRONT END
React JS - React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces or UI components.
Next JS â€“ Was used to build server-side rendering and static web applications using React.
Styled-Components â€“ This utilizes tagged template literals to style the components.
Material-UI - React components for faster and easier web development.
Js-Cookie â€“ Is a simple, lightweight JavaScript API for handling browser cookies, this was used to read the cookie token stored in the browser and was used for authenticating users as soon as they are signed in using the form on the application.
Isormorphic-Fetch - Isomorphic-fetch is implementation of fetch for both Node.js and browser, this was used to communicate with the backend (server) and used to fetch data stored on the server database and pulled to the frontend.
The rest of the libraries/frameworks can be found in the package.json file on the root directory of the project. Any developer that will be doing further work on the project can find the documentation on the README.MD file on the GitHub page useful and straightforward.

LIBRARIES & FRAMEWORKS ON THE BACK END
Node JS â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code server-side.
Express JS â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code server-side.
Mongoose â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code 
Json2cvs â€“ Node.js (Node) is an open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code server-side.

description:
GluCare was born out of the idea that a combination of a human-centric patient approach and a technology working together will lead to a better and more efficient management of diabetes and metabolic syndrome. 

The GluCare team is looking to expand their successful business model from physical interaction to service in the cloud. This new offering will be called Zone.Health. The ask is to build a website that acts as the hub of information in order to get patients to join their program. The various sections of the site will consist of: 

â€¢	â—  What is Zone.health? 
â€¢	â—  The program 
â€¢	â—  Why it works? 
â€¢	â—  Join now 
â€¢	â—  Pricing 
â€¢	â—  FAQs 

We envisage the website to have an onboarding portal which will consist of three parts, an API, a CMS and a Frontend system.

1.	This will allow for future integration into other customer touch points should the need arise. The onboarding journey will consist of: 

1) BMI calculator

If less 27, show a message to say that they donâ€™t qualify. If greater 27, take the user through the registration flow. 

2) Registration (numerous inputs)

Once the patient has provided the above, they will be visible within the custom built CMS. The practitioner will have a login to the CMS whereby they will be able to view the information captured by the patient. They would be able to add specific notes after the consultation and select the medication and the required gear (glucose monitor, wearable and scale) to send to the patient. The idea is that the cost of these items will be built into the system, so that the practitioner can simply select the products, which then creates the payment link. This will be centrally managed in its totality in the CMS. 
Once the payment has been made, the kit will be delivered to the patient and the engagement with Zone.Health will be through the app. However, each month, the practitioner will log into the CMS and create a payment link based on the progress the patient is making. 

All invoices and orders will be available to the patient when logging into the site. It is important to note that the onboarding portal and the mobile app (this has been developed separately and not in the scope of this project) should use the same authentication system in order to prevent the patient having to create two seperate accounts. 
Details will be provided once engagement starts, but we expect the website to consist of:

o	â—  Project set up 
o	â—  Information website build 
o	â—  BMI 
o	â—  Registration 
o	â—  Further screening questions 
o	â—  Laboratory Test Uploads 
o	â—  Schedule a visit 
o	â—  Confirmation 
o	â—  Payment Process 
o	â—  Account Settings

description:
I have a 3D modding application for Final Fantasy VII, and itâ€™s missing critical animation tools. The main things I think it's missing are a Gizmo to move and rotate joints in 3D space, animation splines to make adjustments to direction and speed, and a real animation bar at the bottom displaying your key frames and etc. It's also lacking automatic interpolation between the keys so you can play test the animation without manually adding additional frames, this makes it much harder if you need an animation
to stay within a certain number of frames. The app has an animation retargeting feature, but it could probably be rounded out a bit more to work more like Maya or Unreal. If possible, it would be helpful to make the app platform agnostic so it can work on both Windows and Mac. If thatâ€™s too much reworking, then maybe just a Mac version as well. This isnâ€™t an absolute necessity, I currently use the app with Wine, but an app that can work natively would be much better. 

I didnâ€™t set a budget because Iâ€™m not sure what something like this would cost, and I didnâ€™t want to discourage anyone from applying. If youâ€™re interested let me know what you think, and how much you think you could complete this for. 

The source code and application is here: 

https://github.com/LaZar00/KimeraCS

We are looking for someone with good GCP BigQuery knowledge to help us with tasks such as next date prediction and next value forecasting by using GCP's BigQuery built-in ML capabilities (ARIMA or similar).

Please note that no data visualization dashboard integration is required for this project as the resulted data set will be pulled programmatically / periodically by another internal tool designed to generate HTML reports.

Thank you

title: Multiscreen online video viewer
description:
GluCare was born out of the idea that a combination of a human-centric patient approach and a technology working together will lead to a better and more efficient management of diabetes and metabolic syndrome. 

The GluCare team is looking to expand their successful business model from physical interaction to service in the cloud. This new offering will be called Zone.Health. The ask is to build a website that acts as the hub of information in order to get patients to join their program. The various sections of the site will consist of: 

â€¢	â—  What is Zone.health? 
â€¢	â—  The program 
â€¢	â—  Why it works? 
â€¢	â—  Join now 
â€¢	â—  Pricing 
â€¢	â—  FAQs 

We envisage the website to have an onboarding portal which will consist of three parts, an API, a CMS and a Frontend system.

1.	This will allow for future integration into other customer touch points should the need arise. The onboarding journey will consist of: 

1) BMI calculator

If less 27, show a message to say that they donâ€™t qualify. If greater 27, take the user through the registration flow. 

2) Registration (numerous inputs)

Once the patient has provided the above, they will be visible within the custom built CMS. The practitioner will have a login to the CMS whereby they will be able to view the information captured by the patient. They would be able to add specific notes after the consultation and select the medication and the required gear (glucose monitor, wearable and scale) to send to the patient. The idea is that the cost of these items will be built into the system, so that the practitioner can simply select the products, which then creates the payment link. This will be centrally managed in its totality in the CMS. 
Once the payment has been made, the kit will be delivered to the patient and the engagement with Zone.Health will be through the app. However, each month, the practitioner will log into the CMS and create a payment link based on the progress the patient is making. 

All invoices and orders will be available to the patient when logging into the site. It is important to note that the onboarding portal and the mobile app (this has been developed separately and not in the scope of this project) should use the same authentication system in order to prevent the patient having to create two seperate accounts. 
Details will be provided once engagement starts, but we expect the website to consist of:

o	â—  Project set up 
o	â—  Information website build 
o	â—  BMI 
o	â—  Registration 
o	â—  Further screening questions 
o	â—  Laboratory Test Uploads 
o	â—  Schedule a visit 
o	â—  Confirmation 
o	â—  Payment Process 
o	â—  Account Settings 
o	â—  CMS - View users 
o	â—  CMS - Create payments 
o	â—  CMS - Shipment of your ZoneHealth kit notification 
o	â—  Email Templates Creation 
o	â—  Email Provider Integration 
o	â—  CRM Integration 
o	â—  Scheduling System Integration 
o	â—  Payment Provider Integration 
Video Conferencing Integration 

There are similar businesses in the US and we like this the most: https://joinfound.com

title: Need my Wordpress site Private and only accessible by users that a Super User adds
description:
I have a 3D modding application for Final Fantasy VII, and itâ€™s missing critical animation tools. The main things I think it's missing are a Gizmo to move and rotate joints in 3D space, animation splines to make adjustments to direction and speed, and a real animation bar at the bottom displaying your key frames and etc. It's also lacking automatic interpolation between the keys so you can play test the animation without manually adding additional frames, this makes it much harder if you need an animation
to stay within a certain number of frames. The app has an animation retargeting feature, but it could probably be rounded out a bit more to work more like Maya or Unreal. If possible, it would be helpful to make the app platform agnostic so it can work on both Windows and Mac. If thatâ€™s too much reworking, then maybe just a Mac version as well. This isnâ€™t an absolute necessity, I currently use the app with Wine, but an app that can work natively would be much better. 

I didnâ€™t set a budget because Iâ€™m not sure what something like this would cost, and I didnâ€™t want to discourage anyone from applying. If youâ€™re interested let me know what you think, and how much you think you could complete this for. 

The source code and application is here: 

https://github.com/LaZar00/KimeraCS
